message: In my loooong experience of dieting I always though that reporting every day, telling people what you exactly ate, is a good way to commit. Being on the other side of the atlantic I might be the first one to report every evening but please join, let's all share our interpretations of Lindsay's amazing menus !!!
I just had HH's Apple Jack Smoothie for breakfast! Yep--even I follow my own diet plans! They' keep me nourished and stuffed!

Good morning!  I'll be eating leftover Tuna Salad for lunch and Red Lentil Dal for dinner.  Yesterday, hubby made the Tuna Salad and wrapped it in sushi rice for our lunch.  It was really good and yet another way to use the Tuna Salad recipe.
I have having spicy tomato soup for lunch and Yello Dal & Steamed Kale for dinner!

that's funny Karenne, we almost had the same menu today ! ginger smoothie for breakfast, yellow dal with spinach for lunch and now i'm about to have some spicy tomato soup with few home made sweet potato gnocchi ! have a great afternoon/evening everyone !!
@vm4him I love the idea of making "sushi" out of the mock tuna!
You have me inspired! yellow dal is on the stove now!
bf: toast with pb & honey & banana, L: cauliflower, veggie soup & orange, D: salad bar and lo fat catalina dressing. Snack: peanuts & apple. did a brisk walk for 30 min.
@agnesm LOL  How in the world did that happen?  (grin)  How did your family do with it?  My picky hubby liked it until I told him it was kale which I accidently...waited until after he ate all!
@jackiedee1 ohh you are better than I am.  a walk!  You go girl!

I had a Green Goddess smoothie for breakfast and a 'Taco Salad' with the taco chickpeas from the book mixed into the Basic Side Salad from the diet plans. Ate some baked mac and cheese from the book for dinner with veggies. Somehow managed to convince the doxies to go on a two hour walk today. They are currently sleeping like rocks.

by "them" i don't mean the children, I don't have any but we have 2 friends staying over till they find an appartment in Paris (which could take ages) so I feel like I have a big family staying over now ;)
@KarenneLyn I had the dal+spinach by myself for lunch (my loved one hates lentils AND spinach...) but everyone loved the gnocchi for sure ;) I made it "carbonara style" for them and ate mine plain !!
I am having a tofu scramble (which I love) and home made sourdough bread for breakfast

hey there ! 11pm here, ready for bed !! today I had bread with apple sauce for breakfast, pepper soup & 1 slice of whole weat bread for lunch and cauliflower mash, HH gravy & roasted veggies for diner, it was soooo good ! everyone loved the gravy !

had the toast with pb, bananas & honey, then for lunch a simple vegetable soup hubby made, and for dinner a can of green beans & homemade burrito. snacks were an orange, grapes, and peanuts. 30 min. walk.
today...I am eating sweet potato hash ,TuNoWay (to funny Lindsay) and Spicy Tomatoe Soup for dinner!  Going to try a frozen banana today.  Sounds COLD
morning green smoothie, lasanga rollls for lunch and dinner will eb a salad.

breakfast ginger smoothie, rice with yellow dal leftover and diner ... hum... few slices of bread with vegan cheese before heading to a concert ! now i'm back, it's midnight and everyone around me is eating pasta ... gotta stay strong and focused !

Bonjour ! I just had my very first oatmeal. yes, it's right, my very very first oatmeal ever !!! at 29 that's a bit late, i agree, but oatmeal is far from being popular here in France ... Anyway that was good and quite filling ! i couldn't finish it !! Have a good day everyone :)
I just made HH's Apple Jack Smoothie -- I'm totally addicted to it for breakfast!
I made the Green Goddess Smoothie for breakfast, Mock Tuna Salad is for lunch and still debating dinner
I had Pumpkin Oatmeal for breakfast.  It was very good.  I had a half cup of soy milk along with it.

I haven't officially started on the meal plan yet. I need to get organized and it has been a crazy week , although I have tried some of the breakfast recipes and I love them. Today I had oatmeal with a banana mixed in for breakfast and for lunch I had black beans and rice on top of salad with a little avacado, salsa and my homemade dressing. Tonight we are going to a potluck, I haven't decided what to bring yet.
I had pumpkin pie oatmeal this morning and it was so yummy. It is now my favorite oatmeal.It tasted like dessert.
Me...missed a couple of days but picked right back up. tonight we (hubby loved it) Vegetarian Delight (stir fry) Super Yummy!
Not sure yet... starting with a green juice this morning though... have some greens ready to go bad :)
I made mock tuna fish yesterday, pumpkin bread, hippie loaf and brown gravy, so will be eating lots of delicious left overs today.
Lindsay, I'm allergic to mushrooms.  Is there anything I can substitute for them in the hippie loaf?
@scrappyshel depending on what you have that is going bad...I use the Maple-Glazed Vegetables (pg 174) to use my soon to go bad
B-toast w/pb, banana & honey. L- vegan lasagna & apple. D- vegan chili, baked potato and broccoli.
@KarenneLyn YUMMY!!! That sounds awesome!

I'm on day 1! B: Easy Oatmeal with a banana. L: Creamy Corn Chowder, a side salad, 2 small slices of whole wheat toast. S: baby carrots. D: Baked Tofu w/ an Asian-y BBQ sauce, roasted broccoli & carrots. And I just satisfied my sweet tooth with a little applesauce. Woah! All that for 1200 kcals? Oookay!

I have found the meal plans are too much for me. I eat very simple. Green smoothie for breakfast and a salad for dinner. My lunches I make on Sunday to bring to work. This week was one day of hippie loaf (I had most on the weekend) and 2 days of red lentil dal, 2 days of tofu chiliqueles. Plannin for next week. Thinking black bean enchiladas and something else. Have to think about that something else.

I seem to have caught the office nastiness - granted, I haven't been as vigilant as I usually am over the last week with my eating, and I think that combined with stress has not helped my immune system. What an excuse to eat Chickpea Noodle Soup!
I had kale and sweet potato soup.  It was good...spicy and perfect for a cooler day!
